definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: A sudden gust of cold wind made me shiver.
sentences.chinese: 一股突然刮来的冷风吹得我打哆嗦。

sentences.english: So am I, for that matter.
sentences.chinese: 他冷得直打哆嗦，其实我也是。

sentences.english: He was shaking with flight as if he had seen a ghost.
sentences.chinese: 他吓得直打哆嗦，就好像看见了鬼一样。

sentences.english: And here the cloud shivers with cold.
sentences.chinese: 北极这里很冷，云冻得直打哆嗦。

sentences.english: She forced herself not to shudder.
sentences.chinese: 她竭力遏制自己，不打哆嗦。

sentences.english: The child shivered with pain, but refused to go to bed.
sentences.chinese: 小孩疼得打哆嗦，但拒绝上床去躺一躺。

sentences.english: Private Smith, the soldier with the fever, shivered in the night air.
sentences.chinese: 士兵史密斯发着高烧，冷得直打哆嗦。

sentences.english: He was shaking with fright as if he had seen a ghost.
sentences.chinese: 他吓得直打哆嗦，就好像看见了鬼一样。

sentences.english: I can't stop shivering from the cold .
I stood there quaking with fear.
sentences.chinese: 我站在那儿，吓得直打哆嗦。

sentences.english: Another surge of pain in my ankle caused me to give an involuntary shudder.
sentences.chinese: 脚踝突然又一阵疼痛，痛得我直打哆嗦。

sentences.english: The room is warm now, but he is still trembling.
sentences.chinese: 房间里现在暖和了，但他仍然冷得打哆嗦。

definition: to tremble/to shiver/uncontrolled shaking of the body
calf (back of the leg below the knee)
chilled to the bone/(of the wind) chilly
to feel a chill (as an emotional response)/to feel cold (as a clinical symptom)
to tremble/to shake out/to reveal/to make it in the world
variant of 冷戰|冷战[leng3 zhan5]
to curl up shivering (from cold)/timid and trembling (in fear)/to shrink/to cower
